column4: Should I switch back to Windows XP so that my monitors can work right, or does Ubuntu also have the capability i need and I just can't find it?
so I should just switch back to XP?
on the binarydriverhowto there's a tip on dual monitors
read the ati-section thoroughly
have you tried sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg and then specify your monitors specs to it?
NO
NO, as in you haven't tried it yet or NO as in it didn't work?
I don't think you do? but the changes wont come to effect untill you restart X
so you can just write the line again
/ignore nick
or /help ignore to maybe get more help on the ignore command
my main monitor is working now, I need to figure out how to enable the other one!
did you install that fglrx-control package that was mentioned?
try to execute it from the terminal
scroll is third mouse button
your main screen is 0
atleast that's my guess
are you using hoary or warty?
then it should be /etc/X11/xorg.conf, I don't know why it suggest that though
THANKS!
it works on my comp :-p so don't generalize
